attributes.action: Discuss the idea of the 50+1 Fan Ownership rule for English teams.
attributes.additional_details:
In lieu of what has recently happened with the European Super League disaster, I believe it is now time to revamp how the ownership in football works. Us as fans are at the very heart of football and without us it would cease to exist. 

Yet we're powerless to monumental changes within our clubs. 

There has been no better time to challenge this with football fans in spite of rivalries, united in a stand against the franchise-centric owners of our elite football clubs.
attributes.background:
To introduce legislation that would use the philosophy that the Bundesliga's 50+1 Fan Ownership model uses.

This would allow us as fans to have a say in the clubs we dedicate our support too each week.

We would no longer feel powerless to decisions that challenge lifelong allegiances.

rejection.details:
You may wish to sign this petition which calls for the same action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/583310

You may be interested to know that on 19 April the Government announced a 'Fan-led review of football governance', which will explore ways of improving the governance, ownership and financial sustainability of clubs in English football, building on the strengths of the football pyramid. You can read more about this review here: https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/fan-led-review-of-football-governance.
